channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for IN

item.title: Report X-2023110986
item.description:
Report X-2023110986

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-01T18:14:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-14
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED PACKAGE IS NOTICEABLY WET AND STAINED, DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE OF CONTENTS. CONTENTS INSIDE CONTAINED 2 X 5 LITERS OF CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZING LIQUIDS. PACKAGE FAILED DUE TO LOOSEN BOTTLE CAPS CAUSING LIQUIDS TO LEAKAGE AND DAMAGE PACKAGE ENTIRELY. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

item.title: Report E-2023110373
item.description:
Report E-2023110373

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-18
  • City: FREMONT
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While in transit, a 330-gallon tote containing (UN2735) Sulfix 9252 Scavenger released 1-gallon of product onto the trailer floor as a result of a crack on the top of the tote. It is likely that the tote was not adequately prepared and/or secured for transport. A contractor neutralized that release and cleaned-up the trailer floor. The remaining contents of the tote were transferred into a new, intact tote. No storm drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by the release.

QA staff. hazmat placed in RED hazmat bin DescribePack: hazmat leaking from closure cap/ top of container from pen sized hole DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: absorbent was placed underneath hazmat, them placed in lined hazmat bin

item.title: Report E-2023110391
item.description:
Report E-2023110391

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: EDINBURGH
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 1 gallon of DELTA-THERM™ AE 7105 Isocyanate (UN3500) was released from a metal cylinder due to the valve being open. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed and it was determined that terminal personnel were capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. The valve has been closed and the release is no longer active. The waste into a poly 30 gallon drum and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023110350
item.description:
Report E-2023110350

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-18
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and estimated that two (2) gallons of the paint was released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident. Dayton Freight personnel cleaned the impacted area and containerized the waste in a drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023110349
item.description:
Report E-2023110349

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-30T18:13:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-25
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed that the released material impacted the trailer floor and estimated that approximately two (2) quarts of material was released from one (1) 330-gallon poly tote containing Bonderite C-AK 319 Alkaline Cleaner. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbents to the impacted area and recovered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly pail. The generated waste will be properly disposed of by Dayton Freight’s hazardous waste vendor.

Report X-2023110148

  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS REMOVED OFF OF TRAILER, TOP OF PACKAGE AND TWO SIDES WERE WET. REMOVED FORM ROLLERS AND PLACED INSIDE RED HAZMAT TOTE. DescribePack: CAP ON BOTTLE DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE REMOVED FROM ROLLERS AND PLACED INSIDE TOTE, PKG OPENED UP AND TIGHTENED LEAKING CAP.

item.title: Report E-2023110099
item.description:
Report E-2023110099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-28T18:13:22+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-14
  • City: PLAINFIELD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported a 5-gallon spill of UN1263 "Etching Primer Yellow" from a 5-gallon metal pail caused by a forklift puncture and impacting their dock floor. The SDS was reviewed with the caller who confirmed that terminal staff were comfortable cleaning the spill with proper PPE and ventilation. (1) 10-gallon DM containing 1 5-gallon metal pail of Etching Primer Yellow and Oil Dri of waste was created and left onsite for the terminal to manage.

item.title: Report X-2023110094
item.description:
Report X-2023110094

Identified by scraper @ 2023-11-27T18:13:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-24
  • City: GREENWOOD
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE ARRIVED IN THE QA AREA AND UPON INSPECTION DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT. FURTHER INSPECTION CONCLUDED, PACKAGE NOTICEABLY WET AND FAILED DUE TO INTERNAL LEAKAGE. 4 X 1 GALLON BOTTLES OF CORROSIVE LIQUIDS LEAKED OUT OF BOTTLES ONTO PACKAGE CAUSING ENTIRE PACKAGE TO FAIL. DescribePack: FAILED AT TOP BOTTLE CAPS. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: ONCE PACKAGE WAS DEEMED A FULLY REGULATED HAZMAT, IT WAS SEGREGATED FROM ALL OTHER PACKAGES.

  • City: COLUMBIA CITY

  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY LP

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: While offloading, the driver noticed there was liquid spilling because of the tank overfilling. The product was being delivered into a remote fill and a previous carrier's driver had left the lid uncovered causing the spill.
